dsDescriptionValue.value: Digitized tables of sunspot field strength published in PASP from May 1920 till December 1958.

publicationCitation.value: Pevtsov, A. A., Bertello, L., Tlatov, A. G., Kilcik, A., Nagovitsyn, Yu. A., Cliver, E. W.: 2014, "Cyclic and Long-term Variation of Sunspot Magnetic Fields", Solar Physics, 289, issue 2, 593-602

fields.value:
Published tables were converted to ASCII using Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology. Intermediate results were then manually verified by the following individuals: Alexei A. Pevtsov (NSO, USA), Luca Bertello (NSO, USA), Andrey G. Tlatov (Kislovodsk/Pulkovo Observatory, Russia), Yury A. Nagovitsyn (Pulkovo Observatory, Russia), Ali Kilcik (BBSO/NJIT, USA), and Edward W. Cliver (USAFRL, USA).

In a few instances, the MWO had issued corrections to the original tables (also published in PASP). All these corrections were taken into account in the process of data verification. Finally, we found a small number of inconsistencies in the original tables, which were also corrected.

The data are organized by monthly entries (e.g. "MAGNETIC CLASSIFICATION OF SUN-SPOTS FOR MAY 1920") and then 4 columns provide MWO active region number (No.), estimated date (month and day) of central meridian passage (C.M.P.), latitude (Lat., in degrees), and maximum field strength (H, in units of 100 gauss; no polarity information), which was observed in active region at any time during its disk passage. (later data also show the first and last days of an active region on the disk as well as its magnetic classification). In tabulated data, we only verified the sunspot field strength, latitude, and the date of the central meridian crossing. Data in other columns were not verified after OCR identification. Field strength given in parentheses are estimated values (see explanation in PASP 50: “When it seems probable that the greatest field-strength observed in any group was not the maximum for that group, an estimated value is given in parentheses”).

The field strength at MWO was measured manually using a glass tiltplate. Since the stronger field strengths require larger tilt  angles, this procedure may introduce a non-linearity in the relation between the plate’s tilt and the linear displacement. This slight non-linearity needs to be corrected (for details, see Livingston, W., Harvey, J.W., Malanushenko, O.V., Webster, L.: 2006, Solar Phys. 239, 41).

files.description: The data set of sunspot field strength measurements from Mount Wilson observatory (MWO) provided as MAGCLASS_aap30apr2012_final.txt file represents digitized tables published in the Publications of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific (PASP). The data set covers period from May 1920 till December 1958.
files.label: MAGCLASS_aap30apr2012_final.txt

dataFile.description: The data set of sunspot field strength measurements from Mount Wilson observatory (MWO) provided as MAGCLASS_aap30apr2012_final.txt file represents digitized tables published in the Publications of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific (PASP). The data set covers period from May 1920 till December 1958.
